alert.note: Alert for Milam (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 01 at 6:07PM CDT until September 01 at 9:30PM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Texas, including the following counties, Milam and Robertson. * WHEN...Until 730 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will likely cause urban and small stream flooding. Low lying and/or poor drainage areas will experience minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Cameron, Hearne, Franklin, Calvert, Bremond and Milano.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
